html: He who is “stirred up” or “roars” (yinhom) “in that day”—Jehovah’s Day of Judgment—is the king of Assyria/Babylon (Isaiah 37:28-29). Isaiah likens him to theSea in commotion or aRiver in flood, sweeping all before it (Isaiah 8:7-8; 51:15). Paralleling the Ugaritic myth of Baal and Anath, the namesSea andRiver designate a god who causes chaos in the world, whom Baal, the hero god, must conquer to restore peace. Even when the wicked seek refuge in the countryside to escape the archtyrant’s devastation in the cities (Isaiah 6:11-12), there too thegloom he typifies confronts them (Isaiah 8:22).
